questions.q: What does the <strong> tag do in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <strong> tag makes text bold while also indicating semantic importance or emphasis. Browsers typically render it in bold font.

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a definition list in HTML?
questions.explanation: A definition list uses all three tags: <dl> wraps the list, <dt> defines the term, and <dd> provides the definition or description.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the <q> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <q> tag is used for short, inline quotations. Browsers typically add quotation marks around the content automatically.
options: To create a short inline quotation

questions.q: Which tag is used to display computer code in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <code> tag is specifically designed to display inline code snippets in a monospace font, indicating computer code within text.

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a table in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <table> tag is the container element that creates a table. It contains rows (<tr>) with cells (<td>) or headers (<th>).

questions.q: What is the purpose of the <form> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <form> tag creates an interactive form that collects user input and submits it to a server for processing.
options: To create a form for user input

questions.q: Which attribute is used to specify the alignment of text in a table cell?
questions.explanation: The 'align' attribute specifies horizontal alignment in table cells. Though deprecated in HTML5, it was commonly used for 'left', 'center', or 'right' alignment.

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a dropdown list in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <select> tag creates a dropdown list. Individual options within the list are defined using <option> tags.

questions.q: What does the <textarea> tag do in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <textarea> tag creates a multi-line text input field where users can enter larger amounts of text, such as comments or messages.
options: Creates a single-line text input field
Creates a multi-line text input field

questions.q: Which tag is used to define a table row in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <tr> (table row) tag defines a horizontal row in a table. Each row contains cell data (<td>) or header cells (<th>).

questions.q: What is the purpose of the <th> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <th> tag defines a header cell in a table. These cells typically appear bold and centered, distinguishing them from regular data cells (<td>).

questions.q: Which attribute is used to specify the width of a table in HTML?
questions.explanation: The 'width' attribute specifies the width of a table, either in pixels or percentage. However, CSS width property is now preferred.

questions.q: The <b> tag is used to make text bold in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <b> tag renders text in bold. While it doesn't convey semantic importance (unlike <strong>), it's still valid for styling.

questions.q: The <sub> tag is used to create superscript text in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <sub> tag creates subscript text (below baseline). Superscript text (above baseline) uses the <sup> tag.

questions.q: The <ol> tag is used to create a bulleted list in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <ol> tag creates an ordered (numbered) list. The <ul> tag creates unordered (bulleted) lists.

questions.q: The <blockquote> tag is used to create a block of code in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <blockquote> tag is for quotations, not code. Code blocks typically use <pre> or <code> tags.

questions.q: The <div> tag is used to define a section in an HTML document.
questions.explanation: True. The <div> tag is a generic container that defines divisions or sections in a document for organization and styling.

questions.q: The <ul> tag is used to create a numbered list in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <ul> tag creates an unordered (bulleted) list. The <ol> tag is used for ordered (numbered) lists.

questions.q: The <strong> tag makes text italic in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <strong> tag makes text bold and indicates importance. The <em> or <i> tags are used for italic text.

questions.q: The <dl> tag is used to create a definition list in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <dl> tag creates a definition list, which contains terms (<dt>) and their definitions (<dd>).

questions.q: The <q> tag is used to create a blockquote in HTML.
questions.explanation: False. The <q> tag is for short inline quotations. The <blockquote> tag is used for longer block-level quotations.

questions.q: The <code> tag is used to display computer code in HTML.
questions.explanation: True. The <code> tag is specifically designed to display inline code snippets in a monospace font.
